title: Inferior mesenteric plexus
text:
The inferior mesenteric plexus is derived chiefly from the <a href="Abdominal%20aortic%20plexus">aortic plexus</a>.
It surrounds the <a href="inferior%20mesenteric%20artery">inferior mesenteric artery</a>, and divides into a number of secondary plexuses, which are distributed to all the parts supplied by the artery, viz., the <a href="left%20colic">left colic</a> and <a href="sigmoid%20plexuses">sigmoid plexuses</a>, which supply the descending and sigmoid parts of the <a href="Colon%20%28anatomy%29">colon</a>; and the <a href="superior%20hemorrhoidal%20plexus">superior hemorrhoidal plexus</a>, which supplies the <a href="rectum">rectum</a> and joins in the <a href="pelvis">pelvis</a> with branches from the <a href="pelvic%20plexuses">pelvic plexuses</a>.
